title: President Dissanayake celebrates 56th birthday today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, the 9th Executive President of Sri Lanka, celebrates his 56th birthday today, November 24.  M0RE..

title: CAA to launch special raids during festive season
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced a series of special raids starting December 15 to safeguard consumers during the upcoming festive season.

title: Minor flood situation as Nilwala River water level rises
byline: The water level of the Nilwala River has risen to a minor flood level due to prevailing rainy weather conditions, according to the Department of Irrigation.

title: Sri Lanka, Australia woo Indian tourists with new initiatives
byline: Aiming to cash on growing outbound Indian tourists, Sri Lanka and Australia have launched new initiatives to cash in on this. Sri Lankan Airlines has launched a unique package for Indian tourists- the “Ramayana Trail” that includes 50 significant locations in the country which is associated with the Hindu epic.

title: No electricity tariff revisions this year: PUCSL
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) states that there will be no revision of electricity tariffs for 2024, citing delays in the submission of necessary proposals by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).

title: CEB employees demand bonuses by December
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board Workers’ Union has called on the CEB management to distribute bonuses to employees, citing the board’s profitability.

title: Far right eye breakthrough in Romania presidential vote
byline: Romanians were voting Sunday in the first round of a presidential election amid a surge in inflation and fears over the war in neighbouring Ukraine that could favour far-right leader George Simion.

title: Suspect involved in motorcycle theft arrested
byline: Kahathuduwa Police have apprehended a suspect involved in the theft of motorcycles from several areas.

title: Two missing, 5 rescued after boat accident at lagoon in Negombo
byline: A 50-year-old man and his 20-year-old daughter are reported missing while five others have been rescued following a tragic boating accident in the Munnakkarai Lagoon in Negombo, police said.

title: SEC issues summons for Gautam Adani, nephew on bribery allegations
byline: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has issued a summons to Indian billionaire Gautam Adani, indicted on U.S. bribery allegations related to a bombshell federal indictment against him, a court filing showed.

title: Sri Lankan trawler seized in Maldivian waters with 344kg ‘Ice’ and 124kg cocaine
byline: Following a successful intelligence-sharing operation between the Sri Lanka Navy and the Maldivian Coast Guard, a Sri Lankan fishing trawler carrying about 344 kg of crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’ drugs) and about 124 kg of cocaine has been seized by Maldivian Coast Guard.

title: Sri Lanka’s Megha Sooriyaarachchi shines at Mr World 2024 with multiple wins
byline: The 11th edition of the prestigious Mr World competition has been a moment of pride for Sri Lanka, as Megha Sooriyaarachchi emerged as one of the standout contestants, as the pageant is nearing its grand finale.

title: Senior Prof. S.K. Rathnayake appointed to oversee Ruhuna Uni. administration
byline: An extraordinary Gazette notification has been issued appointing Senior Prof. R.M.U.S.K. Rathnayake to be the competent authority for the purpose of exercising, performing and discharging in lieu of Vice Chancellor of the University of Ruhuna.

title: Heavy showers above 150 mm expected in Eastern Province
byline: The Department of Meteorology states that the low pressure area over the southeast Bay of Bengal is likely to intensify into a depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal by November 25.

title: Measures in place to ensure safe travel for A/L students amid adverse weather
byline: The Matara District Disaster Management Coordination Unit has confirmed that all necessary steps are being taken to ensure students sitting for the G.C.E. Advanced Level examination tomorrow (25) can safely reach their respective examination centers, even in the event of an emergency situation.

title: IPL 2025: Wanindu Hasaranga, Maheesh Theekshana bought by RR
byline: Sri Lanka’s Wanindu Hasaranga and Maheesh Theekshana have been sold to Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) mega auction.

title: Heavy showers above 150 mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the low pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal is likely to intensify into a depression over the central-southwest Bay of Bengal by today morning.

title: 2024 A/L examination begins today
byline: The 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination is scheduled to commence from today (25).

title: Four injured in Watawala bus collision
byline: A private passenger bus has collided head-on with a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus this morning (25) in Watawala.

title: Police announcement on traffic restrictions on Badulla-Bibile Road
byline: Sri Lanka police have issued a announcement regarding the restriction of vehicular movement in the stretch of road between the 143rd and 144th kilometer posts on the Badulla-Bibile Road in the Passara police division.

title: Speaker responds to MP Archchuna Ramanathan’s controversial conduct
byline: The Speaker of Parliament Ashoka Ranwala has stated that he intends to discuss with Member of Parliament (MP) Dr. Archchuna Ramanathan regarding his recent controversial conduct.

title: Three-day workshop for MPs of 10th Parliament begins today
byline: The three-day special workshop for members of the Tenth Parliament is set to commence today (25).

title: Continuing with IMF program will ensure benefits of stable economy reach all citizens - Peter Breuer
byline: The International Monetary Fund’s (IMF) Senior Mission Chief for Sri Lanka, Peter Breuer, stated that Sri Lanka’s continuation of the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) program will support stable and inclusive growth for the country.

title: Wicked, Gladiator II bring in $363 million in global box office
byline: The musical adaptation Wicked and action epic Gladiator II racked up a combined US$270.2 million (S$362.8 million) in global ticket sales over the weekend, a gift to cinemas heading into what may be a record-setting holiday season.

title: Election Commission gears up for LG polls
byline: The Election Commission is scheduled to convene this Thursday at 10.00 a.m., marking its first meeting since the conclusion of the 2024 general election.

title: Apple reportedly offers to invest US$100 million into Indonesia post iPhone 16 ban
byline: Tech giant Apple has reportedly offered to increase its investment into Indonesia to persuade the government to lift its sales ban on the iPhone 16.

title: Court orders to release Sujeewa Senasinghe’s luxury vehicle
byline: The Fort Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release of former MP Sujeewa Senasinghe’s controversial luxury vehicle, which is now in court custody, on a bond of Rs. 100 million, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Public urged to avoid disturbances to students during A/L exams
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, Amith Jayasundara has requested the public to refrain from engaging in activities that may disturb students during the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination period.

title: ADB approves $200 million loan to advance power system expansion in Sri Lanka
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a $200 million loan to upgrade Sri Lanka’s power sector infrastructure, enhancing the reliability of transmission and distribution networks and facilitating greater integration of renewable energy.

title: Unable to provide immediate solution to ‘E-8 visa’ issue – SLBFE chairman
byline: A group of individuals holding South Korean E-8 visas is engaged in a continuous protest in front of the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLFEB) in Battaramulla, demanding solutions to their issues.

title: Adani’s Colombo Port project under scrutiny as US Agency conducts due diligence
byline: United States international development finance corporation, which is partially funding the Colombo port terminal in Sri Lanka, is employing due diligence on the project after the allegations against the Adani Group chairman by the US Department of Justice came to light.

title: Philippine VP publicly threatens to have the President assassinated
byline: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte said Saturday she has contracted an assassin to kill the president, his wife and the House of Representatives speaker if she herself is killed, in a brazen public threat that she warned was not a joke.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara responds to accusations over ‘E-8 visa’ issue
byline: Allegations of illegal financial gains connected to the contentious ‘E8 visa’ scheme have been directed at former Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment, Manusha Nanayakkara.

title: Two new secretaries appointed to ministries
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed two new secretaries to ministries, the President’s Media Division (PMD) stated in a statement.

title: SJB ready to join UNP?
byline: Gampaha District Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harshana Rajakaruna says that the SJB is ready to join together with the United National Party (UNP), if former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will allow Sajith Premadasa to take over the leadership.

title: SC grants leave for petition seeking to suspend holding of 2024 A/L exam
byline: The Supreme Court has fixed for consideration on December 12, a Fundamental Rights (FR) petition filed seeking an interim injunction suspending the holding of 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level examination.

title: 50-year-old sentenced to 8 years RI over child molestation case
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced a 50-year-old father of one, to eight years of rigorous imprisonment (RI) after he was found guilty over the charges of serious sexual assault on an underage child.

title: CEB granted extension to submit electricity tariff revision proposal
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has granted the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) an extension of two weeks for electricity tariff revision submission until December 6, 2024.

title: PM emphasizes importance of restoring parliamentary supremacy
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that in order to restore the Parliament as a supreme institution, which has faced public scorn and disapproval in the past, the Parliamentarians must act with the awareness that they are the representatives of the people.

title: Jaffna District MP apologizes for sitting in Opposition Leader’s seat
byline: Jaffna District Independent Member of Parliament Archchuna Ramanathan, who inadvertently sat in the seat designated for the Leader of the Opposition during the inaugural session of the Tenth Parliament, has apologized for the incident.

title: Emergency hotlines for A/L exam candidates to seek assistance during disaster situations
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) and the Department of Examinations have initiated a joint program to ensure the uninterrupted conduct of the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination, even amidst potential disaster situations.

title: 32 Sri Lankan victims of human trafficking rescued in Myanmar
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Ministry announced that thirty-two (32) Sri Lankan nationals who were victims of human trafficking and stranded in Myanmar have been rescued on Monday (25 November) following a successful, coordinated process.

title: President urges grassroots solutions and law enforcement for disaster management
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized that simply reinforcing institutional frameworks is insufficient for effective disaster management.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for severe weather as low-pressure area intensifies near Sri Lanka
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ alert warning for the land and the deep and shallow sea areas around the island today (25) as a low pressure area intensifies over South-East Bay of Bengal.
